In der Stadt befanden sich mehere wichtige Flugzeugfabriken wie die Arado- und die Heinkelwerke. Nach dem Wiederaufbau wurde die Stadt zu einem wichtigen Industriezentrum der DDR und der Hafen in der Stadt zum wichtigsten Hafen des Landes.

column2: Effective Bombing of Hildesheim
Hildesheim was target of Allied air raids that took place from July 29, 1944 to March 22, 1945.
column4: Hildesheim war zwischen 29. Juli 1944 und 22. März 1945 Ziel von alliierten Luftangriffen.

column2: Effective Bombing of Mannheim

U.S. and British bombing during World War II heavily damaged Mannheim and the inner city area was practically annihilated. Mannheim was a key industrial center and as such a great strategic target. On December 16, 1940, Mannheim was bombed and it was the first deliberate terror bombing of German civilians. The U.S. Army occupied the city on March 29, 1945.
column4: U.S. und britische Bombardierungen beschädigten Mannheim schwer und die Innenstadt wurde praktisch komplett zerstört. Mannheim war ein wichtiges Industriezentrum und hatte daher strategischen Wert. Am 16. Dezember 1940 wurde Mannheim das Ziel des ersten Terrorbombardements auf deutsche Zivilisten. Die U.S. Army nahm die Stadt am29. März 1945 ein.

column2: Effective Bombing of Hannover

Hanover was an important road junction and production center that was a target area of the Strategic bombing during World War II. More than 6,000 people were killed in the Allied bombing raids and more than 90% of the city center was destroyed in 88 bombing raids.
column4: Hannober war ein wichtiger Knotenpunkt und Produktionszentrum und daher Ziel strategischer Bombardements im Krieg. Mehr als 6000 Menschen wurden bei Luftangriffen getötet und mehr als 90% der Innenstadt wurden in 88 Luftangriffen vernichtet.

column2: Effective Bombing of Budapest

Budapest was partly destroyed by British and American air raids towards the end of World War II. While the city was attacked by Soviet troops and defended by German and Hungarian troops, the Germans destroyed all bridges and more than 38,000 civilians lost their lives. Budaoest was besieged from 24 December 1944 to 13 February 1945.
column4: Budapest wurde gegen Ende des Krieges durch Luftangriffe von britischen und amerikanischen Bombern teilweise zerstört. Während die Stadt von Deutschen und Ungarn gegen die Rote Armee verteidigt wurde zerstörten die Deutschen alle Brücken und mehr als 38000 Zivilisten verloren ihr Leben. Budapest wurde von 24. Dezember 1944 bis 13. Februar 1945 belagert.

column2: Effective Bombing of Osaka
The U.S. bombing of Osaka during World War II took place on 13 and 14 March 1945. It is said more than 10,000 Japanese died in these bombings.
column4: Die US-Bombardierung von Osaka fand am 13. und 14. März 1945 statt. Mehr als 10000 Japaner starben dabei.

column2: Effective Bombing of Wien

Wien was bombed fifty-two times during World War II, and 87,000 houses of the city were lost. Only 41 civilian vehicles survived the raids, more than 3,000 bomb craters were counted. By early 1945 Vienna had already faced 1,800 bombs. In February and March 1945, British aircraft dropped 80,000 tons of bombs which destroyed more than 12,000 buildings and left 270,000 people homeless.
column4: Wien wurde im 2. Weltkrieg 52 Mal angegriffen und dabei 87000 Häuser zerstört. Nur 41 Zivilfahrzeuge überstanden die Angriffe und mehr als 3000 Bombenkrater wurden gezählt. Anfan 1945 warften britische Flieger 80000 Bomben abe, welche mehr als 12000 Häuser zerstörten und 270000 Menschen obdachlos machten.

column2: Effective Bombing of Munich
Munich was heavily damaged during World War II when bombed by Allied air forces, it was hit by 71 air raids over a period of six years.
column4: München wurde während des 2. Weltkrieges durch Luftangriffe von alliierten Flugzeugen schwer beschädigt. Über 6 Jahre hinweg wurde die Stadt Ziel von 71 Luftangriffen.

column2: Effective Bombing of Tel Aviv
The Italian bombing of Tel Aviv started in July 1940 and on 9 September 1940, a bombing of the city caused 137 deaths.
column4: Die italienische Bombardierung von Tel Aviv begann im Juli 1940 und am 9. September führte ein Luftangriff auf der Stadt zu 137 Opfern führte.

column2: Effective Bombing of Kure

The bombing of Kure took place from 24 to 28 July 1945 by United States and British naval aircraft. The bombing led to the sinking of most of the surviving large warships of the Imperial Japanese Navy. The United States Third Fleet's attacks on Kure Naval Arsenal and nearby ports on 24, 25, and 28 July sank an aircraft carrier, three battleships, five cruisers, and several smaller warships.
column4: Die Bombardierung von Kure vom 24-28 Juli 1945 wurde von US und britischen Trägerflugzeugen durchgeführt. Dabei wurden die meisten verbliebenen großen Kriegsschiffe der kaiserlich japanischen Marine versenkt. Das Kure Marinearsenal und die nahen Häfen wurden am 24., 25. und 28. Juli angegriffen und dabei 1 Träger, 3 Schlachtschiffe, 5 Kreuzer und einige kleiner Schiffe versenkt.

column2: Effective Bombing of Aomori

The Bombing of Aomori took place on July 28, 1945 and was part of the strategic bombing campaign waged by the United States of America against military and civilian targets and population centers during the Japan home islands campaign in the closing stages of World War II.
column4: Die Bombardierung von Aomori fand am 28. Juli 1945 als Teil der strategischen Luftoffensive der USA gegen miliärische und zivile Ziele in Japan auf den Hauptinseln gegen Ende des 2. Weltkrieges statt.

column2: Effective Air Raid on Taipei

Taipei Air Raid took place on May 31, 1945 and was the largest Allied air raid on the city of Taipei. Despite efforts by Allied strategy planners to minimize civilian casualties, many residents were killed in the raid and tens of thousands wounded or displaced. On May 31, 1945, units of the Fifth Air Force consisting of 117 B-24 heavy bombers were sent to conduct the largest air raid ever on Taiwan. The bombing began from around ten o'clock in the morning and lasted until one o'clock in the afternoon, during which the attack was non-stop. The Allies dropped approximately 3,800 bombs on military units and governmental facilities in Taipei, many other buildings within the downtown area and Japanese quarter also suffered various damages.
column4: Der Luftangriff auf Taipei fand am 31. Mai 1945 statt und war der größte alliierte Luftangriff auf die Stadt. Trotz der Versuche, die zivilen Verluste gering zu halten wurden viele Bewohner bei dem Angriff getötet, verletzt oder obdachlos. 117 B-24 Bomber griffen die Stadt morgens um 10 Uhr bis um 1 Uhr nachmittags an. Die allierten warfen etwa 3800 Bomben auf militärische Einheiten und Regierungsziele in Taipei ab, wobei große Teile der Stadt in Mitleidenschaft gezogen wurden.

column2: x
Ineffective Bombing of Wielun

We have lost the air battle of Wielun!\n\nThe bombing of Wielun refers to the indiscriminate bombing of the Polish town of Wielun by the German Luftwaffe on 1 September 1939. The Luftwaffe started bombing Wielun five minutes before the shelling of Westerplatte, which has traditionally been considered the beginning of World War II. It is considered to be one of the first terror bombings in history and first in Europe in this war. It killed an estimated 1300 civilians, injured hundreds more and destroyed 90 percent of the town centre. It is widely acknowledged that there were no targets of any importance in the area such as military installations or industrial facilities. The casualty rate was more than twice as high as Guernica.
column4: Wir haben die Luftschlacht von Wielun verloren!\n\nDie Bombardierung von Wielun war der Angriff der Luftwaffe auf die polnische Stadt Wielun am 1. September 1939. Die Luftwaffe begann mit dem Angriff 5 Minuten vor dem Beginn der Beschießung der Westerplatte, welche üblicherweise als Beginn des 2. Weltkrieges galt. 1300 Zivilisten kamen bei einem der ersten Terror-Bombardements zum Leben, dem ersten in Europa. Hunderte weitere wurden verletzt ung 90 Prozent des Stadtzentrums wurden zerstört. In der Stadt befanden sich keine wichtigen militärischen oder industriellen Ziele. Die Verlustrate war mehr als doppelt so hoch als in Guernica.

column2: We will get them next time!
column4: Nächstes Mal werden wir nicht versagen!

column2: Incompetent fools!
Ineffective Bombing of Guernica

We have lost the air battle of Guernica!\n\nThe bombing of Guernica took place on April 26, 1937 and was an aerial attack on the Basque town of Guernica, causing widespread destruction and civilian deaths during the Spanish Civil War. The raid by planes of the German Luftwaffe 'Condor Legion' and the Italian Fascist Aviazione Legionaria was called Operation Rügen. The Basque government reported 1,654 people killed, but modern research suggests between 200 to 400 civilians died. Western countries viewed Guernica as an example of terror bombing and gained the impression that the Luftwaffe was committed to that tactic. The bombing was the subject of a famous anti-war painting by Pablo Picasso.
column4: 'Wir haben die Luftschlacht von Guernica verloren!\n\nDie Bombardierung von Guernica fand am 26. April 1937 statt, als Flugzeuge der deutschen 'Legion Condor' die baskische Stadt angriffen und große Zerstörung von viele zivile Opfer verursachten.Operation Rügen, wie der Angriff bezeichnet wurde, verursachte laut der baskischen Regierung 1654 Tote, moderne Nachforschungen gehen jedoch eher von 200 bis 400 toten Zivilisten aus. Westliche Länder sahen Guernica als Terror-Bombardement an und gewannen den Eindruck, dass dies die Taktik der deutschen Luftwaffe war. Die Operation wurde von Pablo Picasso in einem berühmten Antikriegsgemälde behandelt..'

column2: Ineffective Bombing of London

We have lost the air battle of London!\n\nThe Battle of Britain was the air campaign waged by the German Air Force against the United Kingdom during the summer and autumn of 1940. The Battle of Britain was the first major campaign to be fought entirely by air forces, and was the largest and most sustained aerial bombing campaign until that date. From July 1940 coastal shipping convoys and shipping centres, such as Portsmouth were the main targets, one month later the Luftwaffe shifted its attacks to RAF airfields and infrastructure. As the battle progressed the Luftwaffe also targeted aircraft factories and ground infrastructure. Eventually the Luftwaffe resorted to attacking areas of political significance and using terror bombing tactics. The failure of Germany to achieve its objectives of destroying Britain's air defences, or forcing Britain to negotiate an armistice or an outright surrender is considered its first major defeat and one of the crucial turning points in the war.
column4: Wir haben die Luftschlacht von London verloren!\n\nDie Luftschlacht um England war die Offensive der deutschen Luftwaffe gegen England im Sommer und Herbst 1940. Sie war die erste Offensive, die ausschließlich von Luftstreitkrägten ausgetragen wurden und war längste kontinuierliche Bombenoffensive bis zu diesem Datum. Von Juli 1940 an wurden Küstenkonvois und Hafenanlagen wie in Portsmouth hauptsächlich angegriffen, einen Monat später waren Flugplätze und Infrastruktur der RAF das Hauptziel der Luftwaffe. Im Verlauf der Offensive wurden auch die Flugzeugindustrie und Bodeninfrastruktur angegriffen. Schließlich ging die Luftwaffe zu Angriffen auf Ziele mit politischer Bedeutung und Terrorbombardements über. Das Fehlschlagen der deutschen Offensive war der erste richtige Rückschlag im Krieg und wird als einer der wichtigsten Wendepunkte im Krieg angesehen.

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Chongqing

We have lost the air battle of Chongqing!\n\nThe bombing of Chongqing took place from 18 February 1938 to 23 August 1943 and was part of an Imperial Japanese Army Air Service and Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service terror bombing operation on the Chinese provisional capital of Chongqing. A conservative estimate places the number of bombing runs at more than 5,000, with more than 11,500 bombs dropped, mainly incendiary bombs. The bombing of Chongqing was focused almost entirely on the civilian population. In the first two days of the campaign, the raids of May 1939 killed more than five thousand Chinese civilians. Two months later, after tens of thousands of deaths, in retaliation for firebombing, the United States embargoed the export of airplane parts to Japan, thus imposing its first economic sanction against Japan. Three thousand tons of bombs were launched on the city between 1939 and 1942. A total of 268 air raids were conducted against Chongqing.
column4: Wir haben die Luftschlacht von Chongqing verloren!\n\nDie Bombardierung von Chongqing durch die kaiserlich japanische Luftwaffe und Marineluftwaffe zwischen 18. Februar 1938 und 23. column2: Ineffective Bombing of Berlin

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Helsinki

We have lost the air battle of Helsinki!\n\nHelsinki was bombed several times during World War II. Finland fought three wars between 1939–1945, two against the Soviet Union and one against Germany. column2: Ineffective Bombing of Lubeck

Blockbuster bombs in the first wave of the raid opened the brick and copper roofs of the buildings and the following incendiaries set them afire. 1,468 buildings in Lubeck were destroyed, 2,180 were seriously damaged and 9,103 were lightly damaged. The bombing of Lubeck struck a corridor about 300 metres (330 yards) wide from Lubeck Cathedral to St. Peter's Church, the town hall and St. Mary's Church, Lubeck. column2: Ineffective Bombing of Darwin

'We have lost the air battle of Darwin!\n\nThe Japanese air raids on Darwin on 19 February 1942 were the largest attacks ever mounted by a foreign power against Australia. Darwin had a population of about 2,000 at the time, the normal civilian population of about 5,000 having been reduced by evacuation. Truman the U.S. dropped the nuclear weapon ‘Little Boy’ on the city of Hiroshima on Monday, August 6, 1945, followed by the detonation of ‘Fat Man’ over Nagasaki on August 9. Six days after the detonation over Nagasaki, on August 15, Japan announced its surrender to the Allied Powers, signing the Instrument of Surrender on September 2, officially ending the Pacific War and therefore World War II. Germany had signed its unavoidable Instrument of Surrender on May 7, ending the war in Europe. The bombings led, in part, to post-war Japan adopting Three Non-Nuclear Principles, forbidding the nation from nuclear armament.

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Warszawa

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Amien

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Kobenhavn

The target of the raid was the Shellhus, Gestapo headquarters, in the city centre, a building that had been used for the storage of dossiers and the torture of Danish citizens. Members of the Danish resistance movement in the hope of freeing imprisoned members and destroying Gestapo records requested the raid. Unfortunately, a Mosquito in the first wave hit a lamppost and crashed into a school near the Shellhus, and the third wave of bombers attacked the burning school thinking it was their target. 125 Danish civilians died in the school, including 86 schoolchildren. The raid succeeded in destroying Gestapo headquarters and severely disrupting Gestapo operations in Denmark, as well as allowing the escape of 18 Gestapo prisoners. Four Mosquito F.B.VI bombers and two Mustang F.III were lost, and nine crewmembers died on the British side.

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Oslo

The building was not destroyed, but several civilian residences were, and 80 civilians were killed and injured. column2: Ineffective Bombing of Schweinfurt-Regensburg

We have lost the air battle of Schweinfurt-Regensburg!\n\n The Schweinfurt–Regensburg mission was an air combat battle flown by B-17 Flying Fortresses of the U.S. Army Air Forces on August 17, 1943, it was conceived as an ambitious plan to cripple the German aircraft industry. The Luftwaffe also knew the mission as the ‘double-strike mission’ because it entailed two large forces of bombers attacking separate targets in order to disperse fighter reaction. The mission inflicted heavy damage on the Regensburg target, but at catastrophic loss to the force, with 60 bombers lost and many more damaged beyond economical repair. As a result, the Eighth Air Force was unable to follow up immediately with a second attack that might have seriously crippled German industry. When Schweinfurt was finally attacked again two months later, the lack of long-range fighter escort had still not been addressed and losses were almost as high. As a consequence, deep penetration strategic bombing was curtailed for five months.
column4: 'Wir haben die Luftschlacht von Schweinfurth-Regensburg verloren!\n\nDie Schweinfurt–Regensburg Mission war eine Luftschlacht zwischen B-17 Flying Fortresses der US Luftwaffe und deutschen Jägern. column2: Disastrous Swansea Blitz

column2: Ineffective Bombing of Hamamatsu

Hamamatsu was situated on the main flight route from Saipan to either Nagoya or Tokyo and was thus often assigned as a secondary target. In addition to strategic bombing, Hamamatsu was subject to tactical air raids launched by United States Navy carrier-based aircraft, and coastal areas to occasional bombardment by United States and Royal Navy vessels.
